text:
I want to declare my love for the Julia REPL. Looking at my old Python code, I was horrified to find that used Jupyter Notebooks to program, and then copy-pasted the content into `.py` files. I did that because I like interactive workflows, and Python's REPL is abysmal.

Having a good REPL is one of those quality of life-things that *could* have been swept under the rug as "not important". In contrast, Julia has implemented *so many* small things that make the REPL an absolute joy. All of you who contributed to that are much appreciated.

text: Do you use <@U67D54KS8>’s OhMyREPL? If not, you should try that out!

text: I do have that loaded on startup, and it's glorious. Appreciation to him, too!
